channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024120147
item.description:
Report E-2024120147

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-03
  • City: PARIS
  • State:
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ROISSY, FRANCE, ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM CANADA TO FRANCE WAS BEING LOADED ONTO A PALLET FOR THE FINAL DELIVERY DESTINATION WHEN AN EXPLOSIVE SOUND WAS HEARD FOLLOWED BY SMOKE EMITTING FROM THE PACKAGE. THE FACILITY WAS PROMPTLY EVACUATED FOR APPROXIMATELY ONE HALF HOUR. THE LOCAL FIRE BRIGADE AND AIRPORT POLICE, AIR TRANSPORT GENDARMERIE (GTA) RESPONDED TO THE EVENT. PACKAGE INSPECTION REVEALS ONE ECO COUNTER URBAN POST (PEOPLE COUNTING SYSTEM) CONTAINING AN INSTALLED LITHIUM METAL BATTERY. THERE IS EVIDENCE OF A THERMAL LITHIUM BATTERY EVENT HAVING OCCURRED AS EVIDENT BY THE CHARRING AND BURNING MARKS ON THE DEVICE. THE PACKAGE WAS CONFISCATED BY THE GENDARMERIE DES TRANSPORTS AERIENS (GTA) FOR ANALYSIS. ONE EMPLOYEE HAD RINGING IN THE EARS AND WAS SENT TO THE HOSPITAL FOR EVALUATION. THE EMPLOYEE WAS RELEASED AND GIVEN THREE SICK LEAVE DAYS. THE PACKAGE WAS A RETURN SERVICE PACKAGE SHIPPED FROM CANADA TO THE PRODUCT OWNER IN FRANCE. THE OWNER OF THE UPS ACCOUNT IS 82F81F, ECO COMPTEUR, 4 RUE CHARLES BOURSEUL, LANNION FRANCE 22300. THE PACKAGE ENTERED THE NETWORK ON 18-NOV AND WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT YYZ TO SDF, SDF TO PHL, AND PHL TO CDG. THE PACKAGE ARRIVED IN CDG ON 20-NOV AND WAS NOT RELEASED FROM CUSTOMS UNTIL 02-DEC. NRC REPORT WAS MADE ON 06-DEC AS REQUIRED 171.15, NRC 1418132.

item.title: Report E-2025010291
item.description:
Report E-2025010291

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: RIVERVIEW
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On January 17th, 2025, at 12:34, a three-person Veolia team was conducting operations at the ASH Stevens customer site. The Veolia employees were in the process of loading totes onto a box truck using an electric pallet jack. The Veolia box truck was positioned at the customer's loading dock. During the loading procedure, an incident occurred when a tote situated near the front of the box truck (one of the first to be loaded) was accidentally punctured. This happened as the pallet jack operator was attempting to place a second tote behind it, towards the rear/open end of the truck. The puncture occurred in the left-hand lower quadrant of the 275-gallon tote. As a result, the contents began to leak, flowing from the front of the box truck towards the rear while it was still in the loading dock. The leaking material spilled off the truck and into the customer's secondary containment system, where it was successfully contained. The customer's team promptly responded to the situation by transferring the remaining contents of the damaged tote into a new, undamaged container. They also managed to recover the spilled material from the secondary containment area. It is estimated that less than 250 gallons of the material was lost to the customer's containment system.

item.title: Report E-2025010369
item.description:
Report E-2025010369

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-03
  • City: EAST BRUNSWICK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9700
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: When unloading freight from trailer forklift operator was carrying the tote on the forkblades of the forklift. As the forklift was transitioning from the trailer to the dock over the dock plate the IBC started to wobble on the forkblades. The forklift operator tried to move forward back on to the trailer and when doing so the IBC fell over causing the lid to partially rupture contributing to the unintentional release. Defensive actions were immediately taken to contain the spilled material and an outside spill response company was dispatched to aid in mitigating and cleaning up the spilled material. The spilled material was cleaned up by an outside company and placed into multiple recovery containers for disposal.

item.title: Report I-2025010073
item.description:
Report I-2025010073

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: MACON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CARDINAL HEALTH 414, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: While driving eastbound(speed unknown) on Highway 74 at approximately 6:00 AM on 12/16/2024, the vehicle hit a cow that was in the middle of the road. The driver reported heavy fog at the time of the collision. As a result of the collision, the vehicle left the roadway onto the eastbound shoulder of the road and burst into flames. The driver escaped the vehicle and called emergency medical services. h Upon theif arrival on the scene shortly after the accident, law enforcement closed the eastbound lane of the road. This lane of the road remained closed for several hours until being reopened following decontamination of the area in the evening on December 16. After the vehicle caught fire, the flames consumed the vehicle, 6reaching the shipping container and several of the unit dose shields and spreading some radioactive contamination in the general vicinity of the vehicle. EMS worked to extinguish the fire and in doing so, spread some contamination further around the area, reaching approximately 15-20 feet away from the vehicle. Two of the unit dose pigs were later identified in the debris, while another two items that may have been unit dose pigs were also identified. The other pigs appear to have fully melted in the fire and their materials released. It was not possible to identify which specific doses' pigs were intact. Cleanup was conducted by a contractor, Alpha-Omega Training& Compliance, Inc., with direction by Cardinal Health and a representative from the Georgia DNR Radioactive Materials Program. The area was found to be at background levels after cleanup concluded on the evening of 12/16.
